turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why no. She's still on her date with Biff ... is something the matter?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, I ... I was just ... worried about her.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I can't go out there. How can I go out there?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Have you got any make up?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And they won't be able to tell?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No ... They won't be able to tell.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I made you these for the trip. They're marshmallow rice squares.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Thanks. I thought you weren't gonna ...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There's a meatloaf sandwich in there too. Don't go skipping dinner just 'cause you're not here anymore.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And ... wear this on the trip in case it gets cold.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm so proud of you, Bud.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Having kind of a tough time.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well ...  Here's what it's s'posed to look like.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Isn't it great how she's resting like that?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But I really should get home.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: But you can't go out there.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sounds nice ... Once you get used to it.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Yeah.  Or like sprinklers in the summer ...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, swell. You know, Mr. Connel said that if things keep going the way they are, I might be seeing that promotion sooner than I thought.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh darling that's wonderful!  I always knew you could do it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Bud, your sister's a little older now and she's naturally going to start going out with boys.  ... In fact pretty soon--she's even going to get married and make someone a good little home-maker like your mother here.  That's IF she can learn to bake.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But your sister is a fine young woman and she would never do anything for us to be concerned about.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I told you where I was.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I got caught in the storm. You were gone all night too.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look. Let's just forget about it. Let's just go to the meeting and ...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I told you, George. I'm not going.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Look at me George. That meeting's not for me. Look at my face.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's fine. You'll put on some make up and ...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't want to put on some make up ...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It goes away ... It'll go away.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't want it to go away.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Okay--now you listen to me ...  You're gonna come to this meeting and you're gonna put on this make up, and you're gonna come home at six o'clock every night and have dinner ready on this table.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I made a couple of lunches for you and put them in brown paper bags ...  I'm gonna go now.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: What's all the commotion? Where's the cat?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: I sure am glad you said you'd come out with me tonight Mary Sue.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well "gee whizz" Biff. I sure am glad you asked me.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: I don't know if I ever said this to you before, but, well ... I think you're just about the keenest girl in the whole school ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Gosh. I hardly know what to say.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: ... And you always seemed so smart and everything. Like that report you did on "Our Town Hall." Gosh. I didn't know what I'd talk to you about.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well, sometimes talking's over-rated. Don't you think?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: So I know I haven't been steady with anybody, but I just don't want to rush it. You don't want to make a mistake with something that important.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: I mean, there's kids that are even holding hands already but I figure there's plenty of time for that kind of thing later on. Don't you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh you bet.  Will you excuse me for a sec?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: Anyhow ... I really wanted to come over and sit next to you in civics but ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You want to get out of here?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You wanna get out of here? You wanna leave?

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: To be honest Mary Sue. I didn't think you'd want to come here until we'd been pinned for a little while.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, Biff. You can "pin" me any time you want to.

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: I think ... I might be ill ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I said, NO!  ... I've read like one book in my whole life and I'll be damned if I let you throw it on that fire ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh God! Are we in that episode?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You want to ask her out tonight, right? And then you want to give her your school pin ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Lucky guess.  Look, Biff ... I don't think it's a real good time for that right now ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What I mean is ... Mary Sue's been a little "different" lately ...

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: She won't go out with me?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I didn't say that. It's just that right now ...

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: I don't know what I'd do if she wouldn't go out with me ...

turns.speaker: BIFF
turns.text: Gee whizz, Bud. Guess I'll just have the usual. Cheeseburger and a cherry coke.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Maybe you can't even describe it. Maybe you only know it when it's gone. Maybe it's like there's a whole piece of you that's missing too.  You might even call it "love."

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Now don't you think she looks just as pretty in color? Don't you think she looks just as pretty as she did the day you met her?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: C'mon. Everyone's turning colors. Kids are making out in the street. No one's getting their dinner-- hell, you could have a flood any minute ... Pretty soon you could have the women going off to work while the men stayed home and cooked ...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm sure you've noticed the same things we all have--certain "changes" going on in the town.  You know what I mean by "changes"?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: "Changes."  And it's not just the fire or big stuff like that. It's little things.  Did you hear about Bill Miller?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Wife wants him to get one of those new beds.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh my gosh. What's he gonna to do?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I really don't know.  Ben Miller's son just quit his job as a boxboy at the market.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No. They do. And it isn't just 'cause you're a great bowler ... They respect you ...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: And it's important for them to see someone they respect, stand up for what's right. If you love a place, you can't sit around and watch this kind of thing happen to it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: And that's why I want you to be on the Pleasantville Chamber of Commerce.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh my Gosh. I hardly know what to say.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Why don't you start by saying "yes," and then getting me one of those swell pineapple kabobs.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Are you alright?  What is it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, I ... I came home like I always do, And I came in the front door. And I took off my coat. And I put down my briefcase and I said "Honey. I'm home."

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do you know that it's illegal?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Because anybody should be able to paint in whatever color they want.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're not allowed to do this! I could arrest you for this.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Bud Parker and William Johnson, you have been charged with desecration of a public building and the intentional use of prohibited paint colors in violation of the Pleasantville Code of Conduct and laws of common decency. Do you admit that on the night of May 1, you did consciously and willfully apply the following FORBIDDEN colors to the Pleasantville Town Hall:  Red, Pink, Vermillion, Puce, Chartreuse, Umber, Blue, Aqua, Ox Blood, Green, Peach, Crimson, Yellow, Olive and Magenta.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Um ... Yes I do. Where's our lawyer?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We prefer to keep these proceedings as "pleasant" as possible. I don't think a lawyer will be necessary.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do you further admit that this was done surreptitiously and under the cover of darkness?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Good. Do you further admit that this unnatural depiction occurred in full public view where it was accessible to, and in plain sight of, minor children?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Very well. Let the record show that the defendants have answered in the affirmative to all the charges.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I think I've got something to say.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sure. Everybody's upset because they're not winning anymore--but just think how it would feel if all of a sudden they do win.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: See, I know you want it to stay "Pleasant" but there are so many things that are so much better: like Silly ... or Sexy ... or Dangerous ... or Wild ... or Brief ...  And every one of those things is in you all the time if you just have the guts to look for them.  Look at those faces back there. They're no different than you are. They just happened to see something inside themselves that you don't want to ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I thought I was allowed to defend myself.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm not lying ... Here I'll show you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why am I out of order?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: BECAUSE I WILL NOT ALLOW YOU TO TURN THIS COURTROOM INTO A CIRCUS!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well I don't think it's a circus. And I don't think they do either.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: THIS BEHAVIOR WILL STOP AT ONCE.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: But see that's just the point. It can't stop at once. Because it's in you. And you can't stop something that's in you.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Um ... I don't know how to do that, Bob.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Well, I never had to do it before.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You put handcuffs on them and you take them to the police station.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Oh. guess I could do that, then.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: How'd you know about the fire?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: How'd you know how to put it out and all?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look it doesn't matter. It's not important.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: "It was big 'n brown 'n kept goin' an' goin' as far you could see."

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I thought the books were blank?

turns.speaker: MR. SIMPSON
turns.text: Hear your Dad got a new car.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh yeah. A Buick. It's swell.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What color is that hedge of yours?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, not that hedge. The other one.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The one in your mind. The one that you see on a bright cold morning. The one that you see when you walk in front of your house and you just stand there and stare.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: David, cut it out. Mark Davis is gonna like be here in five minutes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well great. The Pleasantville Marathon starts at six thirty.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Omigod, I don't be-lieeeeve this! He's gonna like beeeee here!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Weil great. You can watch TV upstairs.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Upstairs! Up-staiiirs! There isn't any STEREO!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh my God ...  Oh my God ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: David, stop stressing, you can like-- turn it on normally ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No you can't, Jen! It's a new TV. It doesn't work without a remote.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Do you mind. This is like the most important moment of my whole life.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Forget it Jen, I've waited a year for this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: God, David. Just give it to me!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Uchh! Look at me?! I'm like so ... pasty!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You--you gotta get us out of here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know ... It's not possible ...  Is it possible?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm gonna hurl, David. I swear to God.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: All that animal fat. I feel it in my pores or something.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I still don't see why we're doing this.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We're supposed to be in school.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We're supposed to be at home David! We're supposed to be in color!  Oh God ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Okay, now you listen to me! I don't know what's going on but you'd better fix it! I had a date with Mark Davis and I even bought new UNDERWEAR!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We just gotta play along for a little while ... till that guy shows up again. Then I'll talk to him and ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, yeah. I'm ... Bud Parker and you're ... um--Mary Sue.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No! I'm not gonna do it! If I don't dress like this for Mom I'm sure as hell not going to do it for you!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We don't have a choice Jen. We're stuck until he comes back.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why can't we just EXPLAIN IT?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Biff Martin. Captain of the basketball team.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: As a matter of fact he does.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Peggy Jane, Lisa Anne and Betty Jean.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: One date, Jen--that's all I'm asking. If you don't go out with this guy we could throw their whole universe out of whack.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It's too weird David. This place is giving me the creeps. Did you know all the books are blank?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I looked in the library. They got covers with nothing inside them.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What were you doing in a library?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I got lost.  Oh here ... look at this!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Just watch. You know why those guys just get cats out of trees? 'Cause nothing burns around here, that's why! They don't need any firemen ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I like--really need a cigarette, too.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'll get us out of here. I really will. But if we don't play along we could alter their whole existence. We may never get home.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I could like kill a guy with these things.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I've worn some kinky stuff before ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They don't notice that kind of thing.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He-llo? I've got like three pounds of underwire here ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Just go with the program--hunh? I'm late for work.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Couple of cheeseburgers and two cherry cokes.  If you need anything, I'll be right over there.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Gee whiz "Bud", what could we possibly need when we have each other?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What did you do to him?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You can't do this, Jennifer. I WARNED you.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So what's the big deal. Oh. Okay. They're like not good at basketball anymore. Like--omigod, what a tragedy.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You don't understand. You're messing with their UNIVERSE.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well maybe it needs to be messed with. Did that ever like--occur to you?  You know, they don't want to be like this, it's just that nobody ever helped them before.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You have no right to do this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well if I don't who will?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: David, nobody's happy in a Poodle skirt and a sweater set.  You like all this don't you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I mean, you don't think it's just like dorky or funny or something ... you really like it.  Oh God! I am just so personally horrified right now ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I just don't think we have the right to ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: David, let me tell you something. These people don't want to be geeks. They want to be "attractive." They've got a lot of potential, they just don't know any better.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They don't have that kind of potential.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Um--hello? You want to like take a look?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I had nothing to do with that fire.
